definition: having sound and color (idiom); vivid/dazzling
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

color/dice

sentences.english: Community construction is progressing at a steady pace and community services are rendered in various forms.
sentences.chinese: 航头社区建设稳步推进，社区服务开展得有声有色。

sentences.english: He was an unambitious man destined for a commonplace job.
sentences.chinese: 诗人能把平凡的事物描绘得有声有色。

sentences.english: Red lotus led the three children, the fishing bar business to life.
sentences.chinese: 瑞莲领着三个孩子，把渔栏经营得有声有色。

sentences.english: Some people that tell very detailed war stories may not have been there at all.
sentences.chinese: 有些把故事说的有声有色的人根本没有参加过战斗。

sentences.english: They successfully organized many activities in their community.
sentences.chinese: 他们把社区活动搞得风风火火，有声有色。

sentences.english: IT and curriculum become full of sound and colour-vivid and mature.
sentences.chinese: 信息技术与课程整合进行得有声有色，也日趋成熟。

definition: like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
orderly/methodical/rhythmical
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy

everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy

muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess

lit. not one drop of water can leak out/watertight/rigorous (argument)
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
highly effective/fruitful
chaos/bungle/complete mess/shambles
